name: PointOne
headline: Automated time tracking and billing for law firms.
description: Lawyers have to manually track all their client work in 6-minute increments. PointOne uses AI to completely automate time tracking and bill review, helping law firms collect more revenue and saving lawyers hours each week.

founders.name: Adrian Parlow, Founder
founders.description: Co-founder & CEO of PointOne. Previously a corporate lawyer at Fenwick & West, doing financings and acquisitions for companies like Robinhood and Stripe. After that, was General Counsel and in product and ops roles at Wefunder (YC W13).

founders.name: Jeremy Ben-Meir, Founder
founders.description: Working on PointOne to automate attorney timekeeping and billing. Was previously a software engineer at Amazon and Google where I worked on search relevance and Ads ML, respectively.

founders.name: Katon Luaces, Founder
founders.description: Working on PointOne, automating timekeeping and billing. Previously worked on a legal tech product at Google before joining Applied Intuition where I worked on a platform for the verification and validation of autonomous vehicles.

generated_description:
**PointOne: Automating Time Tracking and Billing for Law Firms**

PointOne is a startup on a mission to transform the way law firms handle time tracking and billing. Founded in 2023 and a participant in Y Combinator's W24 batch, this innovative company aims to alleviate the cumbersome process of manual time tracking that has long plagued attorneys. 

Historically, lawyers have to document their work in 6-minute increments—an administrative nightmare that not only wastes time but also leads to revenue loss due to untracked hours. PointOne harnesses the power of AI to completely automate this process, enabling law firms to accurately capture billable hours effortlessly. The recent feedback from their early adopters indicates they’re saving attorneys significant time each week, allowing them to focus more on client work rather than tedious billing tasks.

Currently headquartered in an unspecified location, PointOne operates with a lean team of three. Their product not only automates time entries but also reviews bills, ultimately helping firms boost their billable time by an average of 3-10%. In a legal landscape where every dollar counts, this is no small feat.

As of now, PointOne has secured $3.5 million in seed funding to further develop their platform. Their Group Partner, Dalton Caldwell, lends his experience to help guide the company's growth strategy.

The platform offers a holistic solution that includes features like automatic time capture, retroactive entries, customizable billing rules, and seamless integration with existing billing and practice management systems. They are firmly committed to security, boasting SOC 2 certification and robust infrastructures that ensure client data is kept safe.

To understand PointOne better, check out their website [PointOne.com](https://pointone.com/) or schedule a demo to see it in action. The technology is not just a luxury; it's an essential tool for modern legal practices seeking efficiency and profitability. 

In short, PointOne is addressing a long-standing pain point in the legal industry, transforming a complex, time-consuming process into a streamlined, automated experience. You could say they’re not just changing timekeeping; they’re revolutionizing it for a new era of law practice.
